author: oscaryt66
title: A brilliant service
body:
My mother who is in her nineties fell out of bed last night. She pressed her Careline button and I received a call from West Lothian Careline to notify me of a problem. I attended and found her on the floor. The Careline team asked me to press the button when I was with her to inform them of her condition. The lovely gentleman, Connor, was exceptionally calming and advised he was arranging for the Rapid Response team to come and get her up off the floor - they attended within 20 minutes which was fantastic.  
I noticed this morning that she was in a bit of pain and suffered some bruising. As she suffers from osteoporosis I took the decision to contact the 111 service for advice. I got connected to this service without requiring to wait too long and, again I was greeted by a caring gentleman who asked all the relevant questions and got me transferred to a nurse to discuss further. Everyone I spoke to were professional but also “human” they appreciated that I was worried about my mother’s situation. I was duly advised that I would be contacted by NHS Lothian to advise me where to take her.  
I subsequently attended St John’s Hospital A&E department where the lovely receptionist advised me that my mother was on the “expected list”. After about 5 minutes she was called in to see a nurse/practitioner who examined her and was happy that she hadn’t broken any bones and the minor injuries clinic would provide information on how to manage her pain. After a few minutes we were called again and advised of some exercises and pain relief to take to avoid my mum stiffening up.  
The whole experience has been exemplary, we have spoken to some dedicated and compassionate staff in a timely manner whom I believe truly cared about my mother. I received a telephone call this afternoon from the Rapid Response team to check on my mother’s condition after the fall - what a brilliant service!

author: Bamenda
title: Reassuring endoscopy appointment
body:
In January I attended the endoscope department at Gartnavel Hospital. I was given both an endoscope and gastroscope  
From beginning to end, my experience of the department was one of excellence in all respects.  
I have rarely experienced such a great combination of professionalism, friendliness and reassuring care both before the procedures and while both procedures were carried out.  
Reception was friendly and an auxiliary noticed that I looked uncomfortable while reading prior to to the procedures and adjusted the bed ; a simple detail which says a lot.  
The nurses were exceptionally friendly and were at pains to clarify what would the procedures would entail , but did so in a friendly , caring and reassuring way.  
All of this was said in non -technical language and nurses went to great lengths to explain and inform , but above all to reassure that the procedure would be pain free and not an unpleasant experience in the least - which was the case.  
Dr Curry spoke throughout the procedures, again in a reassuring and clear and informative way . This was much appreciated and actually allowed me to be an interested spectator of what was happening.  
Irene from the Victoria Hospital Endoscope department had kindly phoned to remind me to stop taking iron tablets which I had previously forgotten to hence this appointment was one which had been quickly rearranged.  
I felt ok after the procures and left the ward but had to return as felt quite groggy.  
The response was of the same high quality as the rest of the morning : within minutes , I was given ECG etc and was seen twice by Dr Curry who was happy that this was simply the after effects of the sedation.  
My visit to endoscope was unbelievably pleasant and I feel that I have experienced the NHS at its best in terms of the procedures and the outstandingly caring and friendly personnel who dealt with me.  
It was all very much appreciated.

title: Excellent service
body:
I arrived at 7.50am with a sprained ankle. I was given a number slip upon entry.  Reception processed me.  Within 10 minutes a radiologist made 2 X-rays of my ankle.  A short time later I was given  a diagnosis and provided with a ‘ski boot’ as it was icy outside and I could not manage crutches. (I’m elderly.) My X-rays were sent to Barnet hospital.  Within days I was given an appointment at Barnet hospital on the basis of the x-rays. 
The service was efficient and pleasant.  Finchley Memorial hospital is cheerful, clean and bright and has a pharmacy.  It is easy to park there and to register your car at Reception.  My only caution to prospective patients is that you should hold on to your number slip as Reception was very firm indeed about taking people in provable arrival order only.  I was back home by 9.45am.
I thoroughly recommend this Walk in Service, its pleasant efficient staff and the ease of reaching and parking in this location.

author: jupiterpw45
title: Life changing support
body:
All my life I have been surrounded by severe alcohol abuse, so its no surprise that I have never been a responsible drinker, in fact I became a complete liability. Coupled to this I have struggled with depression and anxiety which I thought I could manage myself by self medicating with drugs and alcohol, this however couldn't have been further from the truth and over time my addictions spiralled until, shortly after lockdown, I had a major nervous breakdown.  
I spoke to my G.P. and was prescribed anti-depressants and a set of counselling sessions. Both of these treatments helped but it didn't help with my addictions. It was then I was told about Inspire. It became very clear from the first time I entered the building that this was the correct place to be. I never felt like I was being judged in any way and that the staff and volunteers had a wealth of knowledge and compassion to offer.  
I have now completed two support groups, five free accredited courses and I have also applied to become a volunteer myself.  
The impact that all this help has given me simply cannot be underestimated, its not selling it short to say they have changed my life. I never thought I would be clean and sober but here I am a few months down the line living my new life and thriving.

author: K121
title: Poor support for disabled people in A & E
body:
I had to attend the Borders General Hospital as an Emergency case via the 999 ambulance service last week. I was cared for in the A&E department for 13hrs  
The nurses & doctors were amazingly kind & skilled.  
I was given strong painkillers orally which helped a little & made the pain more manageable and I was moved into a resuscitation bay within A&E to be monitored more closely.  
In normal daily life I am mobility impaired & use crutches & this was clearly recorded in my medical notes plus I had my crutch with me at all times.  
However when I needed the toilet and I asked and I was walked , using a crutch , to an ordinary toilet. By the time I got there I was desperate & only realised after I’d gone through the toilet door. As it wasn’t a disabled access toilet there were no handrails or mobility aids to help me.  
The member of staff had said they would wait outside the toilet door for me but they left. I had no option but to try to use the toilet & cause more pain to my leg, which I didn’t feel at the time because of oral pain relief I was taking . However, days later, I am feeling it now .  
Can I just highlight what happened to make sure it doesn’t happen to another patient . The reason I was attending A&E was for pain & the oral pain relief, which meant I wasn’t as focused and thinking as clearly as normal. It didn’t mean I suddenly wasn’t mobility impaired. It did mean I still required a disabled access toilet and the member of staff should have realised this .  
As I said, the majority of nurses were amazing but they can’t be in two places at once & other patients were also receiving their wonderful skilled, caring support.  
The member of staff was aware of my health needs so I don’t know why they treated me this way. It made me feel upset and as if my disability didn’t matter. It shouldn’t have happened.

author: octansxj89
title: Kindness and caring
body:
I came to Charing Cross for an operation to have my kidney removed due to a cancer mass.  
The whole process was fantastic and I was really looked after and nothing was too much trouble  
Everyone was was so kind and helpful  
But there are 2 nurses that went out of their way, over and beyond their role, to make sure I was ok. They were both very happy and had a wonderful sense of humour, and so caring that you could write words about how caring they were  
The 2 nurses/members of the riverside team were called Julie and Amaka. They both need to be recognised for being the best of the best

author: muscarg88
title: Painless and professional procedure
body:
I saw 2 wonderful nurses, a clinical nurse specialist Jenny and her assistant Dolores. Needless to say before attending I was extremely apprehensive. I understood that I would need a two catheters.  
The procedure was completely painless and conducted in a most professional way. Jenny interpreted the results for me expertly. I was most impressed with the whole service I would recommend it highly to anyone with urinary problems. I left the unit feeling proud of the service.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Willows15
title: Great support for a worried Mum
body:
My young daughter attended Apau ward 5 recently.  
She was greeted at the door by a friendly, lovely nurse called Rebecca. She showed my daughter to a room and carried out observations, talking to my little girl throughout.  
The Apnp Siobhan who was also so friendly and lovely came and examined my daughter and following a discussion with the doctor was allowed home to complete an antibiotic.  
We where in apau for less than one hour and I was surprised at how quickly she was seen and assessed and discharged.  
It was late in the evening and I know that apau was in the process of closing for the end of shift and I really appreciate the kindness shown by the staff in apau that evening. My daughter was really worried about coming to apau but they made her feel relaxed and settled throughout. I just want the staff to know how much that meant to a worried Mummy.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Jules75
title: Outstanding care from an amazing team!
body:
I was admitted to the Medical Assessment Unit at Monklands hospital following a struggle to manage a chest infection.  
I can honestly say, the care from the ward staff was faultless. Each staff member was caring, polite and professional. In the time we are living, and we are so aware of the struggle the NHS faces, it is easy to imagine that care would be in some way compromised, as in some areas it is. There was no compromise in my experience at all. Well done-you are a fantastic team and made me a whole lot better!

title: Awful people.
body: Left traumatised from my experience when I was 15 or 16 in high school. Was referred to them through a doctor and they sent a guy over to talk to me in my home. Already a horrible decision as my mother is wildly hateful towards anything to do with mental health. My mother was completely in earshot as the guy was asking me questions. I was scared to answer truthfully as he was actively making fun of the questions he was asking, scoffing and telling me that the question will be stupid which made it hard to be honest. Then would call up to my mother to confirm any information as if I was lying to him. Then my mother came down and had a sob story about how my older brothers abuse toward me was somehow hurting him more than me, I brought this up later and they both gaslighted me over it and told me she never said it like that even though she clearly did. He then left and never contacted me again despite the fact that I explained that I was majorly depressed and struggling with bad thoughts.

author: Jules75
title: Great treatment at my GP surgery
body:
I made an appointment at the Tinto Practice as I had an unresolving chest infection. I was treated by the practice nurse in the first instance. She immediately identified an issue with my chest and got a GP to come. I was given treatment there and then and was booked in to the hospital for further assessment.  
I just wanted to say a huge thanks to both Sharon and to Dr Darroch, as I really do think you both were amazing and prevented me from becoming even more unwell.  
The struggles the NHS face are reality, and I want to make sure that people can see the great work which goes on daily, particularly in the GP surgeries who get particularly bad press.

author: ConcernedProfessional
title: Terrible hospital care
body:
So my poor mum was in ward 7 at this hospital in August. Her sodium dropped to a level which the doctors told me was a little bit low, but from my knowledge was a short way off a hyponatremic coma and death.  
I found the nursing staff to be rude. They did drag lifts and moved patients from one surface to another on bed sheets only. In the whole 3 weeks I saw one student nurse and one physio wash their hands. She was also moved to a room with another patients details and personal items everywhere in the room.  
If I didn't go in and wash her she wouldn't have been washed.  
My mum also had a fall and had lots of cuts and bruises (not just from blood taking) whilst in hospital. No one could give me details.  
I informed a doctor on the Monday about concern mum had a UTI. On the Tuesday she still hadn't been assessed. Later she was started antibiotics  
Nurses did blood pressures over fluffy housecoat sleeves. One even attempted to take it on her hand.  
They didn't wash equipment between patients or clean their hands  
One nurse seemed pleasant but nervous and timid around the other nurses!

author: limayp64
title: Never Known Anything like it!!!
body:
I had my doctors appointment. The doctor sent my prescription to the pharmacy in the practice, received some of my prescription with a different person's name on the label, told to come back the next day for the rest of my prescription, went back the next day, the rest of my prescription was still not available. Then I was given the same medication again that I had received the day before and told again to come back tomorrow, given a slip to take back with the outstanding medication again in a different name to mine!  
I was told by the doctor on my appointment to make another appointment for 2 weeks time. Reception told me to come back next week as the appointments were not available to book until next week.  
I sent a request for my medical records over three weeks ago with no reply. when I spoke to the surgery they finally sent me a form to fill in. I sent the form back the same day. When questioned they said I hadn't sent the form back. When they finally realised I had sent the form off I was told it could take up to another week. What on earth is going on at this surgery?  
I have known anything like it.

author: septemberzc85
title: Trying to contact the hospital
body:
On three occasions I tried to get through to cardiology at King George's. The first call was put through to diagnostics, the second time to Queens cardiology and the third time got through to voice mail. I was asked to leave my details but after the recorded message it said thank you and cut me off.  
What a nightmare and a shame as the cardiology dept itself was great when I visited.

author: NIKKIH
title: Painful hysteroscopy procedure
body:
I attended an outpatient hysteroscopy for bleeding post menopause. My letter recommended I take painkillers prior to my procedure so I took x2 paracetamol. I wasnt nervous for the procedure as the letter said most women tolerate it well and I have had a colposcopy with no problems, but I was wrong. Within few minutes I was screaming out in pain. They gave me gas and air and a local injection into my cervix which helped slightly but the pain was way worse than any periods I had ever experienced. I kept saying I'm going to be sick but they carried on and told me it wouldn't take long. I then passed out and came round a few minutes later.  
Upon leaving the department I still had severe cramps and had to sit down and hold my stomach rocking and crying. I just wanted to sit in an air conditioned car as I felt so sick. I really struggled to walk to my car where I was physically sick. The drive home was dangerous as I was crying and in total shock of what I had just experienced. I was rocking while driving clutching at my stomach.  
The severe pains passed in about an hour but I still had cramps until the following day. The letter containing the results of the biopsies said I tolerated the procedure relatively well which was not correct. I am due a further hysteroscopy which I have requested under general anesthetic.

author: Time waster
title: Respectful staff in accident and emergency
body:
The triage nurse in accident and emergency treated me with the same level of dignity and respect that she liked for herself and spoke to me like I was a human.  
The doctor also treated me with dignity and respect ad spoke to me like I am a human.

author: bmc875
title: Patient communications skills
body:
I have had some intestinal and breathing problems for some time. I was taken under the wing of Consultant Surgeon Dr Khine. We have never met.  
He arranged some endoscopies and quite a few CT scans. He has kept me appraised at every stage. Today I got a lovely letter from him advising that all was well and, if needed, he is always there.  
This is a perfect example of patient awareness and care. Thanks to him and all the Endo and CT staff involved.

author: controllerff77
title: Treatment as MH inpatient
body:
I am currently in Wolfson house hospital, North London, my experience has been very strange, I have been in many mental health care settings. Some that have been very challenging and daunting. As for my care inside Wolfson house carries more stigma from nurses and even the consultants because we are mentally disabled. I personally feel like an alien and that does not only reach out on my behalf.  
I know it must take a lot of time and patients to be a nurse and they do go through a lot of abuse verbally and even physically. To be honest most of what I see going on around does not really break me down or over rule my values but we as mental health service users are still human beings.  
Basically what I am trying to preach to who ever is concerned. This hospital feels like being inside a low secure prison it is a very slow prosses to get a discharge, it is very basic in other words not much going on and the doctor are very set in there ways. Thinking they can walk through metal doors like they are invisible, metaphorically speaking.  
To be honest we need more money being put in the pot, giving us more opportunities in life for example more education more activities. My biggest issue I would like to share with you that does not make sense. I was once a service user in Northampton St Andrews hospital I was months before being discharged before the funders told me they could not afford to keep me there. But once they brought me back here in London my doctor told me I will be here for a small amount of time. Again lies it took me almost two years before being granted unescorted leave when my funders told me it will be a few months.  
Yes I have been in mood swings and yes I have been in about half dozen fights in the whole twenty five years being inside mental institutions but even though my crime was horrific I should have served a fifteen year stretch.  
To be quite blunt I feel the authorises have pissed all over me and we as mental health service users must be treated like human being because I do know one thing what you most probably already know, in years to come being insane will be a much more common issue simply because life is becoming to much to handle. So please open your eyes towards being mentally troubled because even though you can not see how painful our problems are, trust me it is very painful and destressing.  
Thank you for reading my speech.

author: rhinojj63
title: Care and attention
body:
My appointment was with Simon. I felt I had his full attention. He worked skilfully through my symptoms, explaining everything. Explained a path to improve my conditions, it all made sense to me. It has left me feeling less stressed, less frustrated and now I feel hopeful there is a way to improve the quality of my life and reduce the pain.  
The listening, attention and solutions are appreciated. I have been in pain for 6 months with one problem on left wrist and 4 months with a second different problem on right hand, meaning my hand dexterity has been noticeably reduced. As an artist and researcher I need mobility and dexterity in both hands. I feel relieved there are probable solutions and very grateful.

readBy.name: Southern Health NHS Foundation Trust - South West Division

author: Mark234
title: Falling off my bicycle
body:
I was coming back from the Tigger Tor fell race and as I approached a right hand turn I assume my bicycle slipped and I came off. The next thing I knew I was sitting on the ground with about 4 people round me - an ambulance was called and came quite soon - taking me to Accident and Emergency at the Norther General.  
The ambulance crew were great - very professional - getting my details, checking my heart etc and giving me some painkillers - they also kept me talking ... which was friendly but also I suspect a good thing to do with someone who has had concussion. At the hospital I was taken through quickly for an initial assessment and X Rays - followed by a scan of my head. I was there for quite a long time (about 5 or 6 hours) frankly, I didn't mind - staff the nurse and the doctor assigned to me were attentive and helpful - clearly carrying multiple case loads. I am now waiting for the results of an assessment of my case from the Fracture Clinic which I have been told I will get tomorrow.  
My one criticism of A and E that I would like noting is that they handed the job of fitting me with a sling to a junior member of staff - the correct fitting and explaining why it was important did not happen. In retrospect with a collar bone that is snapped and digging into my skin I think this is important and could have been done better - my only criticism.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: humanitiesfx99
title: They couldn't do enough for me
body:
I cut through my chin, lip and nose with a blade whilst completing DIY.  
Unfortunately I didn’t get anybody's name as I think I was in shock. I have to say it was the best hospital experience I've ever had at both Grantham and Lincoln hospital.  
The doctors and nurses and the reception staff in Grantham A&E and Lincoln Maxillofacial clinic 9 were genuinely really caring and just wanted to help. I was in a right state and very upset and they just couldn’t do enough for me.

author: Wolly
title: Care of my relative
body:
My relative had been unwell on and off the last 2 months more significant the last few weeks. Sadly they died as a result of whatever had been going on.  
I would like to thank everyone who was involved in their care from their GP practice. The care they and their family received was outstanding. Anytime a Dr was needed or Nurse they attended by home visit or phone. They listened to our concerns and acted immediately. They were all caring and compassionate towards us all and we can't thank you enough. Nothing could have been done better, everything was done so well and we are very grateful to have such an amazing GP practice. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Addlesee83
title: Calm, collected and beyond professional
body:
We wanted to say a massive thankyou to the maternity team at Doncaster. From triage to M1 to the delivery suite all staff were amazing, going above and beyond at every step despite being stretched to their limits throughout the whole time we were there!  
My waters broke at 36 weeks and from the moment we arrived we were informed of what would and could happen, I was admitted straight away and the staff monitored myself and baby on M1 right up to handing us over to the delivery suite at the end of January!  
My induction began and the midwife Karen was absolutely phenomenal, kept me calm and at ease no matter what came up throughout the labour. She was calm, collected and beyond professional!  
We literally cannot thank her enough for getting baby - “lord” as she nicknamed him - here safely! In the early hours he made his entrance into the world!  
So this is us trying in anyway to show our appreciation to Karen and the whole team at Doncaster! Thankyou Thankyou Thankyou!

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good
body: I’ve been very happy with the respons from the surgery. It was quick,polite and eager to help my situation. The GP Dr that saw me was efficient,friendly,clear,and offered me the right plan of action. Thank you very much

title: Very good
body: I’ve been very happy with the respons from the surgery. It was quick,polite and eager to help my situation. The GP Dr that saw me was efficient,friendly,clear,and offered me the right plan of action. Thank you very much

title: No complaints - a great practice
body: Unlike the vast majority of my friends, family and colleagues I can whole heartedly say I have always received exemplary treatment from the lakeside practice - be that at the main surgery in Corby or my local dispensing practice in Brigstock, at either location the staff are friendly, helpful and patient with a customer not used to being in the healthcare professionals crosshairs! I am more than happy with the treatment I have received from all I have interacted with over the last couple of years - keep up the good work! It’s much appreciated.

author: 12jantwins
title: Maternity care
body:
Just a word of thanks for the safe delivery and care of our twins who we welcomed in mid January. Especially to our delivery suit midwife Jordine and student Alanna and all the team who assisted in their rapid natural delivery 😀.  
To those in neonatal who looked after my twin 2 for 12 days especially to Lisa who made us so comfortable and made us very welcome in what can be a daunting experience. To the staff upstairs who had the pleasure of myself and twin 1s company and tears for 7 days 😁 especially to midwife Rachel on day shift thanks for everything.  
P.S sorry Jordine if I haven't got the spelling correct🙈

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Good staff nice building
body: My dad had a small brain operation at queen's. A bit of a wait, but found the staff excellent and the hospital was clean and well run.

title: Empathy
body:
Consultation with Gp that I had not seen before. Was competent and put me at ease.
Listened to my medical problems. Prescribed medication and tests that will help with my ongoing problems.
Would recommend this gp.

title: Efficient and effective elective minor surgery
body: Once I was on the Consultant schedule, a minor hand surgery with local anaesthetic was conducted efficiently and effectively with good team work from each contributing team

title: Thank you
body: Very quick and very efficient service. From initial appointment to having my wisdom tooth took out. The student and supervising dentist were absolutely incredible. I had a wisdom tooth that needed extracting and everything about the process was great. The student did an absolute amazing job removing my difficult wisdom tooth despite my nervous shakes. I was constantly asked if I was okay etc throughout the extraction and the risks were explained perfectly. By far the best experience I've had with dentistry. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: ariesbj64
title: Wonderful staff but hard to book transport
body:
I am partially sighted and have macular degeneration. After I had cataract surgery I had to start having eye injections at Ayr Hospital. It was after the cataract surgery they said that they weren’t going to see me anymore and couldn’t do anymore for me. But that is when Dr Merchant wanted to see me and got in touch and took it further and I’m still his patient which is great. He said actually, he wants to see me again and that’s when he has organised these injections for me to try and clear a blood clot I have.  
I was absolutely delighted that he went out of his way to see me again and organise more treatment going forward. Dr Merchant is the surgeon in the hospital. I had had injections in Nov and Dec, but I missed my January appointment because I never received the letter I think because of postal strikes. But the hospital called me to see where I was which I think is great. They have booked me in for next injection at the end of next month.  
I was really disappointed to miss my appointment because Dr Merchant is wonderful, but it is great they called me to find out why I didn’t attend.  
Dr Abbey did my last two injections in Dr Merchant’s clinic. I would say to anybody don’t be frightened to go for these injections, they are very very good at what they do. The nurses there (one called Michelle and one was Siobhan I think) they were absolutely excellent and they looked after you and made sure you felt comfortable, they are really really good, so don’t be afraid.  
There’s a nurse you see just before you go in too and they’re all just lovely and really know what they’re doing and very very nice.  
My problem now is trying to get a patient transport ambulance to take me there, because there’s no way I can go on a bus and I can’t afford a taxi. You have to phone ten days before which is a nightmare for me, and I know they are busy and I appreciate the fact that I get access but I’m anxious about calling to book. I try and phone the number and I’m waiting for hours and hours. I nearly spend a whole day and then call another day and I still can’t get through.  
I’m in sheltered housing and partially sighted and it is hard to get there. I don’t have anyone else to take me and it’s very hard to get through on the phone. Once you get through it’s okay  
They tell you to be ready for 8:00 am in the morning. Then they don’t come for you til probably around 11:00 or 12:00. Even though it’s terrible to get through but I really do appreciate everything they do for me.  
Mr Merchant is lovely and Dr Abbey and her team and wonderful. The very fact he said he wanted to see me after the hospital said they couldn’t do anymore for me if wonderful. I’m very very grateful

title: Endoscopy Unit
body: I had a gastroscopy in the endoscopy unit and I can honestly say that it was the best experience I have had in a hospital environment.  I arrived ten minutes before my appointment very nervous and I was seen on time. Staff were very friendly and and reassuring and had no problems with the procedure whatsoever. I was home two and half hours after leaving home.

title: very helpful
body:
every one that I have seen have been very helpful with any problems that I have had.
And they have dealt with any concerns  that I have had.  I am very happy with all the staff at the practise.

title: Amazing Day Surgery
body: I attended Fairfield hospital day surgery unit for Heel and leg surgery.I was so terrified,but from entering the hospital onwards,I was treated with respect,all the staff from receptionist to the Consultant talked me through everything which gave me the confidence to have the surgery.They where so caring,I was so cold with fright that even the anaesthetist brought me 3 warm blankets,such caring people,the nursing staff and doctors are exemplary.I was discharged home with all necessary medications and instructions as required.A truly brilliant day surgery unit,I cannot praise everyone enough,a very grateful thank you,I will not be frightened for my next surgery when it is due.Thank you again.

author: intensityzn66
title: Fantastic service by everyone.
body: I just wanted to thank Jenny and Nicola at NHS 24, I contacted them over the weekend they where very professional and had excellent communication skills. I was quickly put in touch with an ANP Heather at Fife OOH who arranged a prescription for antibiotics. Fantastic service by everyone.

author: Happychappyalive
title: NHS success, it’s not all bad.
body:
Thank you to administrations at the Western General Edinburgh.  
I was overdue a routine 5 year colonoscopy and with short notice ( a week) was offered the opportunity to go to Queen Margaret Hospital. Dunfermline, first thing (Sunday) morning, great. It was well organised, friendly, quick and thorough, no pressure to have sedation so was able to drive home, having no after effects from the procedure.  
The bonus for me was free parking and coming from Edinburgh it was quicker than crossing the town to get to the Western General. Thank you to all the staff for their efforts in keeping us alive. I’m sure if I’d waited for an Edinburgh appointment, I could have been stopped for drunk driving, if spotted constantly swerving/weaving, in, out and around potholes taking a circuitous route avoiding roadwork congestion, not that there appears to be much work in relation to zoned off sections of oor toon.

author: columbabm56
title: Amazing support from my midwife
body:
I gave birth to my baby boy at the end of January 2023. My birth plan that I had originally planned and hoped for did not happen, the exact opposite of what I wanted occurred. However what has given me so much peace and gratitude is the amazing midwife who helped me through my delivery experience.  
I met Claire when I was 7cm dilated and had just received an epidural. I genuinely cannot explain in words how thankful I am for her, but I will try my best. Claire firstly is a breath of fresh air, she is a walking angel who honestly lit up the room when she walked in (metaphorically). She dimmed all the lights, put some music on and just created such a warm and safe environment in what can be a very clinical unfriendly area. Having had an epidural and being in hospital for nearly 30 hours already, I was exhausted and dignity really was out the window. Claire immediately sorted me out making me extremely comfortable and clean. She moved me every couple of hours, checking my position, changing my pads and she just treated me with such respect. She made me feel like a human and empowered again when I just felt so weak and down getting the epidural.  
She was so professional in everything she done with such a warm personality that let me ask every question under the sun and she answered it openly and honestly. Her standard of care was the best I’ve seen and dealt with throughout all my meetings within maternity.  
She was so compassionate in every way, she is absolutely someone I would want to take care of me and my family. I felt so so safe with Claire, and she made my experience amazing. I can’t thank her enough & hope she gets the recognition she deserves.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Hysterectomy under ward 5
body:
Amazing experience yet again at Macclesfield Hospital. Massive thank you to the gynaecology team and all the staff on ward 5 for the excellent care I received. Nothing was too much trouble and reassurance was at every corner. They turned a very scary experience into such a positive one for me and I am extremely grateful. Everything went exactly as I was told and I am now recovering very well one week later at home. 
Thank you all so much!

title: Perfect
body: At reception I told the lady that I was deaf She quided me to the X-Ray Dept. 3 other members in that dept also knew I was def On completion of X-Rays I was back to Reception, then the lady came for me when my taxi arrived

title: Great advice and care
body: I would like to pass my compliments to the nursing team at the Ridings Medical Group.  I recently attended the Brough surgery for my annual asthma check up.  I received lots of extremely useful information and reminders on how to best manage my medication and health in relation to asthma. It was delivered in such a friendly and caring manner and I’m sure the advice given will keep me healthier. I’ve always found the nursing team to be friendly and helpful and always put you at ease. Thank you!

title: Faultless Practice
body: fantastic level of care from all the staff at Lydden Surgery. The whole practice I cannot fault. I am Extremely grateful. Cannot fault.

title: Brilliant service
body:
I needed to put an eConsult in at the begining of the month for knee pain and was booked in for a telephone consultation with a physio the next working day who gave me a treatment plan.  Unfortunately this didn't help so I submitted a new eConsult and was phoned by my GP the next day.  He listened really carefully to my issue and preferred treatment option and booked me in immediately for an xray and for a cortisone injection which I received the next day.  At all times I was kept fully informed of the options I had and my wishes were very much taken into account.

All staff at the practice are friendly and professional and treat you as individuals with your own specific needs.  Excellent.

title: Fantastic professional service
body: I was made to feel extremely comfortable. I highly recommend  Nurse Anita Rowe, she is such a lovely lady and was very thorough,kind and professional.

title: Excellent service
body:
I have been at this practice for many years and have always received excellent service.  For someone who works long hours and shifts I particularly like the new working practice since covid. You are always able to request a call back from a Doctor which for me is better than always having to make a appointment. The call is always thorough and are able to send photos or even video call if needed. The Doctors are always helpful and I don't feel like the calls or appointments are rushed. 
When calling for my young daughter I felt reassured and no different to being assessed face to face. When I have requested to be seen face to face this has never been an issue either. 
I would like to thank all the staff at the surgery they are doing a great job.

title: Prompt appointment
body: General Practioner listened to my problem. Gave me advice and prescribed medication.  This prevented a more serious infection and I am well on the road to recovery.

author: Peter 123
title: Thank you so much for looking after me
body:
I was taken in by the day care staff at Omagh Hospital, where I was briefed on my procedure by Rebecca who was very friendly and informative. Once taken in for my procedure I was introduced to Gemma, Christine and Colleen who were lovely and calming staff. Colleen carried out the procedure and was able to answer all my question on the examination. The team really made me feel at ease and helped make the procedure as painless as possible. Colleen explained what she identified and my aftercare treatment, which eased my concerns of possible results. I was taken to recovery by Christine and transferred to Roisin, who was very friendly and helpful, in organising my lift home. Overall the hospital was really clean and tidy, the staff I encountered were excellent and so professional.  
Thank you so much for looking after me.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent service
body:
The receptionist was friendly and the waiting room spacious.  My appointment was on time and the dermatologist warm, reassuring, professional and informative.
Thankyou for an excellent experience.

author: Marpm83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Hospice Home Care Team
body: To everyone in Hospice and Home Team thank you for all your kindness and understanding.  We really appreciated it.  Keep up your good work.

author: Pix158
title: Making my short stay a positive experience.
body: I attended day surgery for a procedure under general anaesthetic yesterday and would like to give a huge thanks to everyone involved in my care. Special mention to nurse Yvonne who took the time to explain about the procedure before and after. I cannot fault the timely process from being admitted to being discharged and making my short stay a positive experience.

title: Great Practice
body: Having been treated at Oak Tree Health Centre for many years I have always found all sections of the practice, to be professional, knowledgeable and willing to go out of their way to give the best advice and help that is available in a friendly and supportive manner.

title: Efficient and Friendly
body: I attended  as a new patient check up and was treated with respect and dignity Very friendly staff and  the practice was clean and and welcoming.   i also attended a  virtual appointment and again the doctor was understanding and helpful. They us the  latest time saving technology  to  order prescriptions. Just Brilliant.

title: Great service
body: I had a very positive experience with Spa Medica. From the referral to the first appointment was very quick, the staff were pleasant and everything seemed very organised. I have had both eyes done within three months, excellent service.

author: Marpm83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Palliative Helpline
body: Whoever I have spoken to in the last week have been so caring and helpful - it is just a wonderful service - at a very stressful time.  A big thank you to all I have spoken to so far.

title: Exceptional surgury
body: New phone system works so well. Very impressive. Recepsionist was able to give me all the information I needed without having to speak to a dr

title: Great practice, great doctors amd nurses
body: All the staff is very nice, helped me everytime. About reception's person, she can be more kindly but is not a big problem. Thank you for all your help

title: Telephone Appointment
body: GP called as arranged & thorough review performed over the telephone. GP was courteous, professional and able to answer questions asked and asked questions pertinent to the review and future actions . Very satisfied.

title: Friendly
body:
Friendly, helpful and professional. 
I am always able to get an appointment when needed.
Very compassionate and caring practice.

author: Arunner
title: Caring approach
body:
I attended Whitehill's Health & Community Care Centre for bloods to be taken and a blood pressure check.  
At this time I was feeling very low and weepy. The nurse took time to sit and chat with me to calm me. Her whole manner and way of being was lovely and helpful. I appreciate the kindness given by her.  
We ended up chatting about running, I hope she keeps going and enjoys her runs.

title: Outstanding service, thank you!
body:
My son was referred to your service - for an urgent assessment in the middle of the night last week - by 111. The appointment we were given was within 45 minutes of the call (just long enough for me to drive him there); parking was easy and the building felt safe and secure (despite the hour); we waited just a few minutes to be seen; and above all else, the assessment was impressively thorough and reassuring with the clinician spending time with us carefully explaining what she was testing for and why throughout. For something that needed an emergency assessment, the whole response from when the 111 clinician called back was first rate.
I had real trepidation about calling 111 because the thought of spending prolonged time in A&E with a very poorly teenager was such a concern.  In reality, we received quick, thorough, and highly reassuring attention through your service.  Thank you!

title: Excellent GP
body:
I have seen 2 GPS recently & I have had excellent service, advice & help from both of them. 

Xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx xx.

title: A Life Saver
body:
Driven almost insane by a continual pain (24/7) in my arm, I was lucky enough to be referred to the Pain Clinic for treatment.

From initial appointment and throughout treatment I was treated with kindness and care.  Not only was I listened to but I was heard and that made a huge difference to my recovery.

This team deserve more recognition than they get and I hope others feel the same.  Long may their good work continue.

title: Quick and Helpful Service
body: This practice has updated procedures for appointments and I was extremely impressed with the telephone method of achieving a quick telephone response from reception for a telephone consultation appointment. The GP call was prompt and efficient. I was very pleased with today's experience.

title: Excellent Service
body: Just had a call from Harvey group pharmacist, the information I was given was very helpful and beneficial. Thank you

author: Ken23
title: Broke my tib and fib in Jan 2022
body: Fell of my bike when going over black ice. Was signed off work for 3 months. Normally very active so recovery was challenging . Staff at Perth and Dundee were fantastic ,

title: Excellent experience.
body: First time visiting as a patient and from the ease of parking, friendly welcome and skillful consultation it was a perfect experience.

title: Great practice
body: Very helpful, friendly and professional receptionist who made my appointment. Appointment booked 2 weeks in advance with the precise doctor I needed to see. Efficient text reminders. Excellent follow up. Text message received the same day outlining the result of my appointment

title: Very quick and efficient service.  Kind responses.
body: I applied on line for a telephone consultation, I received a call back almost immediately.  The GP who called me was very kind and thorough and he was able to support my needs. Great service, thank you.

title: Amazing hospital
body: The staff were amazing, although very bust when we arrived with my 3 year old son, they made it a comfortable, helpful, friendly and kind experience. They were all so attentive although under pressure and were so good with my son who had nose planted our coffee table. I am grateful to have this minor injury unit down the road with lovely dedicated and hard working staff, thank you to every single one of them.

title: Purley practice
body: I saw the receptionist today at Purley, 1st February. You say I am not allowed to name her, but please identify her as she was absolutely brilliant. I have a bad anxiety problem, and she managed to get me a face to face appt with a doctor who I had dealings with before. She too was so sympathetic and put me at ease. Both are a credit to your practice. I only wish I could name them both.

author: Debsd68
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Intermediate Care Mental Health Team
body:
Dear Ms K  
I would just like to express on behalf of myself and our family how much we appreciated the care my Dad received from Thomas. He went above and beyond his role and I know that my Dad really looked forward to his visits and chats.  
Tom always kept me in the loop with any concerns he had which I feel is very important as a daughter. It is a great shame that everyone isn't like him.  
Once again thank you all for Dad's care  
Many thanks

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: sigmagd98
title: Very much appreciated and grateful thanks.
body: I attended Ward 16 (pre-assessment) Woodend Hospital, Aberdeen at the end of January, 2023. Although very busy, this appointment was fitted in at the very last minute, notwithstanding this, Jill gave me the most thorough pre-assessment, patiently going through my long and complicated medical history. Very much appreciated and grateful thanks.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: snowxn93
title: Got bloods done
body: Got bloods done. Staff were brilliant and very kind. Fantastic service in Downpatrick downshire site

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very supportive
body:
The practice have been very supportive during my Mum's illness, both in terms of keeping me informed and Mum comfortable. 
The reception staff have been helpful despite being always busy.

title: wonderful care
body: I have needed to use the services provided by the practice too much of late. However the service I have been afforded has been brilliant from all departments and now the Pharmacy changing hands has completed the five star excellence of this outstanding practice.

author: pagermh35
title: Treatment of genital warts
body: Prebooked an appointment. The staff were welcoming and professional. The nurse was thorough, efficient and froze the wart. Excellent service. Good job.

title: Swan Lane Surgery.  Amazing Doctors and staff
body:
I 'm just posting a small review.
Whilst the entire Medical profession is not an ideal situation, I always find the Receptionists, Doctors, Nurses and staff to be amazing.
They are always helpful and try their very best to help us when we need them.
It is not always possible to get the appointment we would like but with the limited resources and increased workload I know they are doing everything in their power to help us all.

So, a big thanks to all you it is truly appreciated

title: Perfect
body:
Had cataract surgery in my right eye. The whole experience was fantastic from receiving my appointment to the final discharge.
Every member of staff were polite, respectful and professional. My eyesight is brilliant now and I have no need to wear glasses after 75 years. Thank you for everything Spa Medica.

title: Great prctice
body: The doctor dealt with me very professionally. I was more than satisfied with the consultation and treatment given. I would recommend the practice.

author: woodpeckerxz54
title: I am on the orthopaedic ward as I have been suffering with knee pain
body:
I am on the orthopaedic ward as I have been suffering with knee pain for a long time now, I have went under surgery early February but unfortunately it didn’t fix the pain. I was brought back in last week and went under surgery again in hopes for improvement procedure.  
The surgeon and his team in Craigavon Area hospital have been amazing, they have taken their time with me to get my situation dealt with. From just being out of surgery from a couple of days ago they have been great at seeing how I am and if I need anything. The surgeon still comes up to see me and asks how I am. I have felt as if I have been really cared for and listened to by him and his team. They have done a great job and I thank them.  
I am still in a bit of pain but this is normal since I am only recovering from surgery. I was told that it will be a while before I get back to exercising but once I have recovered a bit I will be able to see the physiotherapist and hopefully they will be as good as the team up here in the Orthopaedic ward.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Impressed!
body: I am a diabetic and have regular reviews for my medications and health in general.  I can't fault the service I have been provided with.  I have been with this Practice for many years and in general, I cannot fault the service provided so thank you.

author: composeret79
title: What could have been undignified and embarrassing simply wasn't.
body:
I am in hospital at the moment because I have been having issues with my bladder at the moment. I came in on Monday and was informed that I will have to have a bladder pressure test completed, this test was quiet painful so it was not a good way to begin the week, but the staff were just great even though at times I you could tell they were under pressure they still ensured that the care that was given was great.  
All the staff on this ward have been so friendly they clearly knew exactly what they were doing. What I liked about the staff on this ward is their professionalism just even by the simplest way of introducing themselves when they come into my room.  
The staff have a level of understanding, and they always explain clearly at each stage what they are going to be doing and what it was showing. They moved the screens so I could see too, and when I asked if I could take a photo of the screen the diagnostic info was printed off, and the findings explained.  
What could have been undignified and embarrassing simply wasn't.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Extremely helpful and quick turnaround
body: I needed to speak to someone so used the engage consult service on recommendation from the receptionist who offered to walk me through it, I manged without but appreciated the offer. The staff and doctor were extremely quick with getting my issue resolved and I can't fault how understanding they were of my situation. I also had an appointment with a nurse for heart monitoring at the end of the last year and she was very kind, reasurring and helped me get to the bottom of the situation and explained what would happen every step of the way, my partner even remarked on how good she was with me. The staff are a real credit to the service and I appreciate having them there when I need it the most. My little boy is also registered with Tod GP and he loves the doctor he has seen there, a real bonus when he is unwell as it makes the situation a little less stressful. Thank you all!

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: We are so grateful as a family for all the care
body:
Story by family member of 60-69 year old female patient from Dungiven area  
Service was excellent. Every staff member was so pleasant and took time for mammy and the family. Nothing was rushed. Very professional, caring, understanding and helpful.  
Sadly mammy has since passed away.  
We are so grateful as a family for all the care of the NHS over the years for both parents.  
Thank you all.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Best surgery
body: Professional prompt service every time.  Great communication, treatment and results. Very lucky to be registered with this surgery given comments from family, friends and colleagues regarding their surgeries.

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Can't rate the team highly enough.
body:
Story by family member of 80+ year old patient from Derry/Londonderry area  
This amazing team made our nightmare journey as comfortable as possible. They were always available and generous with their time- the OT exceptionally so. The OT was here daily and was very organised and considerate. Can't rate the team highly enough.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: From the bottom of our hearts and with our forever prayers.
body:
Story by 80+ year old female patient from Claudy area.  
Words are inadequate to describe the quality of acute care we received. Immediately felt like a burden of anxiety had been lifted. I was a nurse in my day and the efficiency and professionalism given to me was just excellent. I will never forget Dr Khan, Sister O'Hara, Edel, Geraldine, Concepta, Kerry and of course Donal.  
From the bottom of our hearts and with our forever prayers.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Angeleyes55
title: Going above and beyond
body:
My mum, who is profoundly deaf and end stages of dementia came in to have kidney stones removed. Her over night stay turned into a 3 week stay with many complications. I can not speak highly enough of the staff. They have been amazing, Dr Tyson, Dr McCann, nurses, nursing assistants, service staff on West 1 thank you doesn't seem to be enough. They treated mum with such dignity and care but also us a a family who have had to sit with mum. I also want to thank the microbiologists who have worked tirelessly to find the right antibiotics she has need. A special thank you to the surgical staff who have been amazing.  
In a time when there are so many pressures and I have my issues with the waiting list that have had an awful affect on mum, these on the ground staff are the life blood of this trust.  
A thousand thank yous are not enough to express how we feel. You seemed to go above and beyond for a wee woman who is our world.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: wezencm84
title: Treated very well
body: Lymphoedema. I was treated very well by Tissue Viability services. Everything was great.

author: Thepeanuts
title: Amazing staff in endoscopy
body:
I just wanted to say how amazing the staff were in the endoscopy unit whilst I was there- I was really anxious and they all took great care of me  
There was a lovely team spirit amongst all the staff and they were efficient  
Thanks especially to Louise and Michele for their reassurance and compassion

readBy.name: Warrington and Halton Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: great practice
body: i had taken my last tablet of sertraline and was getting very anxious as i had run out,i needn't have worried as some were delivered the very next day thank you for your amazing service to all staff at northbrook i am extremely grateful xx

title: Absolutely amazing
body: The receptionist are extremely friendly they have a few brilliant doctors. Also I can always get an appointment when I call first thing in the morning

title: Great service today.
body: Thank you to the receptionist today who handled my call regarding my appointments and queries excellent service today kind,caring patient and very very professional manner.

title: Professional. Friendly, caring
body: I moved to this practice from another recently and I am extremely happy I did. Their service has been excellent, prompt and efficient. I really can’t find fault.

author: Coco4
title: Professional and competent Dermatology Service
body:
My first visit to Litchdon House dermatology service was in June 2022 for a biopsy, where all who attended to me were very kind respectful and helpful. The biopsy being carried out very professionally by Kerry. I received the results which indicated a nodular and infiltrative basal cell carcinoma, and a telephone appointment was made for me. I remained in all day but for some reason the call was not received. This does point to the fact that telephone appointments do sometimes for no apparent reason, have a downside. In my view for those sort of issues, there is nothing like a face to face.  
This aside a letter was kindly written by Dr Waterfall to Dr McGrath for her help and advice on the matter. I was then given a date to see her in October 2022, and was informed that she would carry out surgery within a couple of months. After a number of unavoidable cancellations, and an agreed change of plan, I finally had the surgery in January 2023, and how lucky I feel that I am to have Dr McGrath and her 2 nursing assistants to carry out the procedure.  
I was kept informed all the way through the procedure, and the surgery was carried out extremely professionally, and with great competence. I consider that our health service is so very lucky to have such a clever and caring member of staff, who instills so much confidence into the patient, and attending nurses who are so dedicated and attentive. Thank you to everybody who attended to me right through from reception to Surgeon.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

author: coinkg38
title: Respiratory care
body:
I have been quite poorly over the years, with pain in the left kidney, and I am on a high dose of morphine to help, but I was beginning to be pushed from different doctors cos they didn't know what to do next. To top it off I had pneumonia, and found I had copd emphysema, so I'm fed up with being ill.  
I hadn't seen a doctor at the local surgery or hospital since before the pandemic, my respiratory nurses came out and one couldn't hear me breathe out so I went to have an x-ray and they found 2 blood clots. I think I heard the doctor say something about an enlarged heart.  
I was kept in overnight, put on blood thinners and next day I was sent home. I am not well some days, the pain in the left kidney and in my chest is so horrendous I don't know what to do. I'm tired, and fed up with the pain. I'd love to get rid of the kidney, that's giving me pain, and I'd love to breathe again without wheezing and using inhalers.  
On Friday last week i attended an appointment at Grantham. I give them top marks for looking after me, but I want to feel better. Friday was a good day, today on a pain chart of 1 to 10, this is 8; the kidney pain is bad, my breathing is sporadic, I just want the kidney gone and then I'll be able to cope again.  
Mr Simpson is lovely and has helped me over the years but how do you get to see your consultant, you can't see a doctor to get referred. I'd love to be able to see Mr Simpson and tell him how ill I feel, and get him to sort out the kidney, then we could work on the breathy thing.  
My brother was so worried about me he bought me a mobilty scooter, which is a god send. I have days when I can't move. Today I have a cold hot pain in my left lung, the pain is horrendous, and the pain from the kidney is so bad I don't know what to do. I also have fibromyalgia, so stress makes my body hurt, it then magnifies it and then it strikes other nerves in the body. I want to be able to do stuff, but I can't, I can't even work because i never know what the day is going to be like, sorry about this but I'm fed up with the pain, and not having a life.

author: KBalou
title: Prompt treatment for a broken right wrist
body:
:One very recent Thursday lunchtime, I thought I had sprained my wrist badly when I fell on it in the house and phoned local health centre to ask if they could bandage it for me as it was my dominant hand. They said no, that I had to have an x-ray and advised me to call 111. Prompt answer from 111 and had a 3-way conversation incl a nurse. They said they'd phone me back with an appointment for Forth Valley Royal Hospital and 10 mins later did exactly that.......it was for 45 mins later.  
My son drove me to the 1:30pm appointment. After checking in, I got straight through to x-ray dept, was very soon seen by someone and soon after that was x-rayed. Not long after that I was called back through and shown the crack in my wrist. I was given a splint and sent home with an aftercare leaflet. Everyone I had contact with was very positive and friendly and I was told I'd be contacted within 5 working days to visit orthopedics.  
The next day, Friday, I had a text from that dept and a letter arrived the following day, Saturday, telling me an orthopedic surgeon had looked at my x-ray and deemed a plaster cast appropriate - appointment on the Monday morning.  
Again I found staff to be very friendly and caring and Claire plastered my arm (with the colour of my choice!), assisted by Magda. After it dried I saw the nurse who checked me over and gave me an appointment 4 weeks thence.  
I feel very privileged to have been given such a thorough, efficient, all-round experience. I feel confident going forward with my recovery and secure in knowing I have a number to call and a name, should there be any problems.

readBy.name: Office of Michelle Thomson, MSP for Falkirk East

author: footballmj46
title: Had a injection in my thumb
body:
I was made to feel very supported by pleasant and very helpful staff, Although there were lots of patients the staff organised them which helped to take anxiety away, I was given tea and biscuits after my surgery and was allowed to take my time while getting ready for going home. I was dreading the procedure of having the injection but the theatre staff made me feel relaxed.  
I would definitely recommend going to Cannock hospital as all the staff were friendly, caring and compassionate to me and made the experience less of a uncomfortable experience.  
Thank you Cannock hospital

author: julymm67
title: Inflexible appointment system
body:
Can’t make an appointment.  
My husband had a head injury 30 years ago. He does not understand new systems of working or online stuff in general. Hanging on the phone for 1 hour and 40 minutes means he’s given up making an appointment. Last week the nurse phoned to tell him his cardi gram was ok but his BP readings were high. There was no reference to the sleep study he’s been promised no letter has been sent.  
He can’t take his tablets for high blood pressure they make him itch day and night.  
He needs different tablets but not beta blockers . He has mental health issues as he sleeps from 10 pm til 10:30 am. It takes him 2 hours to get going, wash and dress and he’s slowly losing his independence.  
How can he engage with the service when all you offer is at 8:00am to get on the phone or come to the surgery?  
Then he could be sent away to have to come back. So immediately he’s given up.  
There are other people like him as I work with special needs so what provisions are there at your practice to give disabled people and those with mental health a chance?

author: pelicanxe86
title: Long wait
body: Far too long a wait in A&E for my aunt. No cardiologist on call.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
